@ZoeAdjonyoh 's mantra “Let yourself be carried away by the momentum of big ideas” was the guiding principle for the SB zine. I had a big idea three years ago: I wanted to see the joys and complexities of what it means to be human in one publication, everything from uplift to

wine recos to games. With brilliant creative director/collaborator Meagan Bennett we made this big idea a reality and, with the help of @ranwein launched at FAB. Shot at the FAB event with three of the zine’s contributors Zoe, @TayLanzet , @cheetieku , the reel gives
you a tiny taste of our pov. To purchase, head to

I can’t believe it’s been 20 years since I founded Share Lunch Fight Hunger-a campaign to support @CityHarvest work feeding kids over the summer when school is out. This year, I’m donating $2 for every RT this gets this week http://cityharvest.org/sharelunch #WeAreCityHarvest

Let's raise the stakes! I'm donating $20 for each RT this gets before 5/19 in honor of 20 years of Share Lunch Fight Hunger! I founded this campaign in 2002 to help @cityharvest feed NYC kids over the summer. With so many families in need, this work has never been more important!

Against the backdrop of depression, fear, guilt in her immigrant household in the Bronx, star chef and guitarist @Cheetieku found her love of food and music.Pod link for more on her remarkable story. "As an immigrant kid you're kind of isolated, and your parents are terrified--
and that was the one 30 minute part of our day that was normal."

building these drinks. If you want to build something that's complex, and has bitterness and layers you've got to put in some work." Pod link

When reporting on suicide: -Include resources for people who need help -Avoid oversimplifying on the cause -Don’t get hung up in the details of the means of death, the less graphic and specific, the better -Don’t lionize the person -Don’t sensationalize the outpouring of grief
